pages.text: A hearty dish of tender beef and veggies in a thick broth. The oldest record of beef stew was found in Japan around the 8th century BC.

pages.title: Beef Stew
pages.text: $(br) Time: 3-4hr$(br) 4 Servings$(br2)$(l) Ingredients - $()$(li) 1 tbsp oil $(li) 1lb boneless beef roast $(li) 3 cups beef broth $(li) 2 medium carrots $(li) 2 large potato $(li) 1 medium onion $(li) 2 cloves garlic $(li) 1 bay leaf $(li) 2 tbsp flour $(li) salt and pepper

$(li) Chop beef, carrots, and potatos into 1-inch cubes; Roughly chop onion. $(li)In a large bowl, toss beef cubes in flour until all bits are coated.$(li)In a large dutch oven, heat oil over medium heat. Add beef in batches so you don't over crowd, cooking on all sides for about 5 minutes per batch until brown on all sides. $(li) Remove beef, add the broth and bring to a boil. Scrape the bottom of the pot with a wooden spoon until everything is loosened.

$(li) Add bayleaf, salt, and pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer 2 hours to 3 hours or until beef is almost tender. $(li) Add carrots, potatos, and onions. Continue simmering until veggies are tender, about 30min. $(li) Remove bayleaf, salt and pepper to taste, serve on its own or over rice.
